intro: Alyxia evansii, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in rocky soils and dry environments. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are usually pink or red, blooming in summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Alyxia evansii is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
